message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.CE, cs.EM. 

The paper discusses the development of energy-efficient Neuromorphic Systems-on-a-Chip (NeuSoCs) using memristive devices integrated with mixed-signal integrated circuits on a CMOS substrate. This work involves addressing algorithmic challenges and issues at the device and circuit interface. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also discusses the development of CMOS synapse circuits based on the concept of CMOS memristor emulator, which falls under the sub-category of cs.ET (Emerging Technologies). The paper also discusses the integration of memristive devices with general-purpose CMOS, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) and cs.CE (Circuit Design). Finally, the paper discusses the energy-estimation of a NeuSoC system and the prediction of desirable circuit and device parameters for energy-efficiency optimization, which falls under the sub-category of cs.EM (Embedded Systems).
